description.narrative: Institutional and local actors have improved capacity to gradually increase social protection for poor and vulnerable children and adolescents in a performance, accountability and risk-informed framework, in rural and urban areasUNDAF/Produit 6.1 : Les mÃ©canismes de ciblage, de gouvernance, de suivi et Ã©valuation de la protection sociale sont amÃ©liorÃ©s, which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children With Disabilities, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses (Covid), Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Evaluation And Research, Evaluation And Research (Covid), Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Skills Development, Social Protection, Social Protection (Covid). UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: The most vulnerable families, children and adolescents (boys and girls) benefit from a gradual increase in social protection coverage, equity of access to basic social services in their communities and opportunities for empowerment and development

sector.narrative: Cash Transfers - social protection data management (management information system, social and beneficiary registries, M&E systems)

National social protection strategies: Policies, strategies, legislation and coordination (inter-ministerial, donor)

Social welfare workforce strengthening - Case management, referral, capacity development

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Institutional and local actors have improved capacity to gradually increase social protection for poor and vulnerable children and adolescents in a performance, accountability and risk-informed framework, in rural and urban areasUNDAF/Produit 6.1 : Les mécanismes de ciblage, de gouvernance, de suivi et évaluation de la protection sociale sont améliorés

description.narrative: UNICEF supported the Government within the framework of the implementation of the National Strategy of Social Protection by identifying on the one hand the socio-economic profile of the children of less than 5 years living in extreme poor households and on the other hand introducing into the cash transfer program a new system of essential family practices for the change of positive behavior. UNICEF also supported the assessment of the costs of providing care to better control the resources to be mobilized in free care systems. Finally, UNICEF supported the Government in drafting the law on social transfers. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:09/02/2020
